page.title: 02St. MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: { St. Mary's Church}is in the diocese of Ripon. A church has existed in Swillington since before the time of the{Domesday Survey of 1086.}The main body of the present building dates back to the latter part of the 14th Century. The{tower,}originally built in the middle of the 15th Century, was re-built and re-faced in 1884 in ashlar stone which has attracted dirt from the local industry over the last 100 years, making the tower a distinctive black colour. The tower contains a peal of eight{bells}which were transferred from St.Matthew's, Holbeck in 1979. The three original bells,two of which date back to 1656, have been retained in the tower. On the south side of the nave are a group of pews known as the{Lowther pews. }
